author: Abraham Riesman
title: Why Your Favorite Brand Is Like a Friend Science of Us
text:
And now, let's talk about love. But not the love we have for our favorite people â€” instead, let's take a look at the love we have for our favorite brands , which, according to some fascinating studies in consumer psychology, sometimes can look eerily similar. Twenty years' worth of research on this subject argues that people form actual relationships with brands , and when one team of German scientists recently tried to quantify this at a physiological level, things got a little weird.
To find out what happened, watch the latest episode in the new five-part Science of Us series "This Is Your Brain on Advertising." You can also check out the previous episode to find out why sex doesn't actually sell very well , and be sure to come back next week for more psychological insights into the world of advertising.
